what r tsukkomis sir please explain or else i will cry daily

@GoodSmellingPieceOfShit it's a japanese comedy term.  According to Urban Dictionary: "The act of pointing out that something is ridiculous or silly. Usually this is something another person (known as the "boke") says or does. May involve violence towards the boke, such as hitting them on the head with a fan (esp. in anime) or slapping them on the forehead."

@GoodSmellingPieceOfShit In Japan there is a style of comedy called Manzai in which involves 2 performers. One, the Tsukkomi, acts as the straight man to the Boke, who acts as the funny man. In most of hololive's comedic dynamics, Subaru acts as the Tsukkomi.
@Adam Malloy yep, and in this case, Kiara unleashing the bottom left jokes and then Subaru saying something like "KIARA?!" haha
@kohi san what does bottom left mean? Low smart x low purity reference?
@Joshua Dela Cruz yes
